title: Portfolio Site
description: The site you're currently on! This is my longest running project and I'm incredibly proud of how it has turned out and improved from where it started. I'm constantly changing styles and updating content as I learn more. As soon as I start to feel comfortable with where this site is, I get a new idea to run with, so it's always changing. Hosted on Github Pages.

title: Noodle
tech: React.js, Python, Flask, Github, Heroku, APIs
description: A full-stack application for finding concerts in your local area. This is my largest scale project, and I'm hoping to link this with an affiliate code with ticketmaster if I can get approved at some point! I'm really proud of how this has turned out, and I continually improve it as I think of ideas. Uses Python Flask, React.js, Leaflet, TicketmasterAPI, SpotifyAPI, Heroku.

title: Teeny Link
tech: React.js, HTML, CSS, Github, Heroku, Python, Flask, Firebase
description: An application that can shorten a url. Uses Firebase to store target long URLs and generated short URLs. Made using React, Python Flask, Firebase, Heroku

title: Pokedex Application
tech: React.js, Node.js, HTML, CSS, Github, APIs
description: An application that fetches data from the PokeApi to display information on the Pokemon game series. Made using React, PokeApi.co, and Node.js.

title: Asteroids Game
description: A game inspired by the asteroids arcade game. Built using Unity.

title: Evermana WoW Addon
description: An addon I created for the popular MMO World of Warcraft. Displays the current mana points of the player in circumstances when it is not visible by default.

title: Spotify Clone
tech: React.js, Node.js, HTML, TailwindCSS, Github, Supabase
description: A study into recreating the Spotify web application's design and functionality. Made using React.js, Node.js, TailwindCSS, Github, and Supabase.

title: Restaurant Site
description: A demo site for a restaurant to display their menu, about page, and contact information. Made using React.js, HTML, and CSS. Hosted on Github Pages.
